subject: RE: [junit] Testing package private classes
msgSnippet: Thanks. That s what I ended up doing. But I was checking to see if there is another way. Anand ________________________________ From: junit@yahoogroups.com
messageBody:
Thanks. That's what I ended up doing. But I was checking to see if there
is another way.

Anand

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of Jim McMaster
Sent: Wednesday, May 18, 2005 3:49 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] Testing package private classes



-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf
Of Anand Narasimhan (anandn)
Sent: Wednesday, May 18, 2005 1:55 PM

> How can I test package private classes with JUnit. Our test
cases
> are generally in a "unittest" subdirectory of the directory
where
> the
> classes being test are.

I prefer to set up a test directory with a parallel package
structure, just because of this issue. It also allows the
creation
of package-protected test-helper methods in the production
classes.

Another advantage is, a separate test hierarchy makes it easier
to
deploy a jar file without the test classes.

- --
Jim McMaster
mailto:jim.mcmaster@...
